snippet: Ten days after Pakistani troops moved into Miram Shah in an offensive against a main jihadi hub, many of the militants that had been hiding there had escaped.
abstract: Pakistani troops have reportedly established control over 80 percent of tribal town of Miram Shah with relatively modest casualties; military says in total just 24 soldiers have died while more than 400 militants are believed to have been killed, mostly by airstrikes against militant compounds in surrounding mountains.

byline.original: By ISMAIL KHAN and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Ismail Khan reported from Miram Shah, and Declan Walsh from London. Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan, and Kiran Nazish from New York.

lead_paragraph: Ten days after Pakistani troops moved into Miram Shah in an offensive against a main jihadi hub, many of the militants that had been hiding there had escaped.

headline.main: Pakistan Claims Win Against Militants Along Afghan Border, but Enemy Slips Away
headline.print_headline: Pakistan Claims a Win, but Enemy Slips Away
